body: LEAD: Bay Ridge, in my memory, is where my grandfather drove the Borden's Milk wagon up to the house every morning to get his breakfast, in the middle of his route. He came into the house on Sixth Avenue, and my grandmother gave him eggs and sausages and bakery rolls for the drippings, and the white horse ate from the oat bag tied around his nose.
title: NEIGHBORHOOD VIGNETTES FROM & NEW YORKERS; FLASHBACKS: Back to Bay Ridge

body: LEAD: Dining for a Cause Dining for a Cause In Westchester County, N.Y., and Fairfield County, Conn., March 22 will be an evening of dining for a cause. Thirty-four restaurants and country inns in those counties are preparing elaborate dinners to benefit the March of Dimes, which works to prevent birth defects. The group is celebrating its 50th
title: Food Notes

body: LEAD: THE next time someone tries to sell you a bridge in New York City, be sure to ask for a warranty. Officials say about half the city's bridges are rated in poor or fair condition, 31 have had to be at least partly closed off and 100 need to be replaced. title: THE REGION; NEW YORK'S BRIDGES ARE CRUMBLING TOWERS OF NEGLECT

body: LEAD: FRIDAY IN THE DRAGON'S YEAR FRIDAY IN THE DRAGON'S YEAR Two days into the Year of the Dragon, the Chinese Lunar New Year is still being celebrated at the Asian American Arts Center, at 26 Bowery, south of Canal Street. Several programs of traditional Chinese music, dance and folk tales are to be presented this weekend. Regional Chinese New
title: WEEKENDER GUIDE

body: LEAD: The Belt Parkway was closed to all traffic for about six hours yesterday in Brooklyn when pieces of concrete fell on the six-lane highway from an overpass at Flatbush Avenue, the police said. Traffic was backed up as far as the Van Wyck Expressway and Cropsey Avenue as the police detoured traffic around the overpass starting at 3:30 P.M. The
title: Falling Debris Shuts the Belt

body: LEAD: Two men surrendered to the police over the weekend in the slaying of a gypsy-cab driver in the Williamsbridge section of Bronx on Friday, the police said yesterday. body: LEAD: A 15-year-old burglary suspect was shot in the neck yesterday during a confrontation with four police officers in the stairway of an apartment building in Brooklyn, officials said. body: LEAD: The president of a bank, its former president and two New York State tax agents have been arrested as part of a Federal investigation into the tangled financial affairs of Irwin Schiff, an enigmatic millionaire businessman who was slain in a Manhattan restaurant. title: Bankers Held in Case Tied to Restaurant Slaying

body: LEAD: A 31-year-old Brooklyn man was arrested last night in the stabbing death of another man during a fight in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn.
